description.para: Gives an alias to object or command.

param.param_note: Specifies another program that can explain alias definition, you can define the file name yourself. The default file name is CMD.EXE .
Reads from and defines alias from file that contains alias definition

example.eg_note: Lists all aliases. Output the result:
example.eg_result: Dumping all defined aliases for CMD.EXE. armsdk =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\extern\armsdk\$1 build =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\build\$1 ela =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\elastos\_%ELASTOS_BUILD_KIND%\$1 gnusdk =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\extern\gnusdk\$1 inc =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\build\inc\$1 lib =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\build\lib\_%ELASTOS_BUILD_KIND%\$1 misc =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\build\misc\$1 obj =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\obj\_%ELASTOS_BUILD_KIND%\$1 root =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\$1 sam =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\src\samples\$1 src =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\src\$1 tools =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\build\tools\$1 winsdk =cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\extern\winsdk\$1

example.eg_note: Lists detail information about alias tools. (tools=cd /d %ELASTOS_ROOT%\build\tools\$1) outputs the result:
